title: Fix AnimationCompleted event not firing with EventToCommandBehavior
body:
`SKLottieView.AnimationCompleted` event fails to trigger when used with `EventToCommandBehavior` in MVVM scenarios:

```xaml
<skia:SKLottieView Source="wait.json">
    <skia:SKLottieView.Behaviors>
        <toolkit:EventToCommandBehavior
            Command="{Binding NavigateCommand}"
            EventName="AnimationCompleted" />
    </skia:SKLottieView.Behaviors>
</skia:SKLottieView>
```

## Changes

- **Async event dispatch**: Wrap event invocation in `Dispatcher.Dispatch()` to avoid conflicts when handlers perform UI operations during property change notifications
- **Single-fire guarantee**: Add `animationCompletedFired` flag to ensure event fires once per completion, reset on animation restart/repeat/reload
- **Test infrastructure**: Update `SKLottieViewTest` to inherit from `DispatchingBaseTest` for mock dispatcher support

## Implementation

```csharp
// Before
if (IsComplete)
    AnimationCompleted?.Invoke(this, EventArgs.Empty);

// After  
if (IsComplete && !animationCompletedFired)
{
    animationCompletedFired = true;
    Dispatcher.Dispatch(() => AnimationCompleted?.Invoke(this, EventArgs.Empty));
}
```

> [!WARNING]
>
